since youre normalising high end stuff...
what about mid item parts? like {{item:3191}} or {{item:3057}} (both 1200g) compared to {{item:3136}} (1500g now)

shouldn't guise be 1200 becos, if 1 adds armor, 1 adds mana, & guise adds hp... all at 25ap, then guise should be 1200 also...

plus, the 25ap never made much sense anyway? shouldnt all mid end items be normalised at 30ap now instead? compared to 100ap, meaning a triple increase of power with full item??

so either, u decrease guise cost, or increase low end ap, cos a tome is already@20ap, so, +5ap increase to next item = big effing deal!
cause it gives magic pen too

Hey Riot! Just Wondering If the New HUD is coming Out Because well I Love It , Its Neat and I love the lvl Up button Plis Rito <3

the only good thing I can see that'll come out of the new hud is if riot gave us the option to switch between the two... it doesn't really affect gameplay is someone else has it and i'd really like to keep this one we have now so at least give us a choice riot... and if you can please let us choose with the maps... i know you'd have to clean up the old map but give us the option to make league look old again. i dont want to resort to 3rd party programs to customize it because they're very unstable and i'd rather you just give us a choice...{{item:3070}}
It's still in testing and honestly I feel like it's unrefined still. I think a customizable HUD would be better IMO.

why :( why did u nerf my thresh {{champion:412}} ?? riot plzz....
they actually buffed him, you can hook someone near the end of your lantern de-spawn time and it'll remain there for allies to grab until you've finished re-activating death sentence.
In what way did they nerf him? There was nothing there to say that he was nerfed. Re-read it and don't jump the gun on calling something a nerf next time...

O we Gave 20 more AP to Nashors {{champion:10}} But we took 10% attack speed off it. I'm Sorry did kayle not want or need Attack speed primarily? It's the only way she can win trades, especially since you only buffed the damage on her E.

Uh doesn't that balance it out? Kayle has a higher ratio on her E, Nashor's Tooth has a higher AP scaling but less attack speed. Sincerely speaking, if you were bursting someone like Kayle can do, a single Q and a few whacks of Righteous Fury is all you really need to munch down on their HP the entire game. For sustained fights it sort of stops her dealing damage out too fast giving the enemy a chance.

Yeah. It was reduced from 50% AS to 40%. That is a loss of 1/5 of the damage. However, it's AP went from 60 AP to 80 AP. That is an increase of 1/3. Therefore the damage output should overall increase by 2/15 or like 6.6% increase.

I feel like having the strongest slow taking priority for certain champions is a slightly precarious movement such as with my much loved {{champion:91}} 's Cutthroat (E) ability. For example, applying {{champion:75}} 's Wither (W) ability to an enemy for (at max rank and time [5 Seconds])95% slow and with Talon suddenly, no, IMMEDIATELY jumping to them afterwards and applying a gobsmacking 99% slow... and wait for it... for 0.25 seconds, at all ranks mind you (IIRC this is the strongest slow in the game, albeit at the cost of a tiny duration). By doing so, you basically defeat the purpose of someone applying a slow over a longer period of time with it only to be immediately cancelled with a immensely stronger yet much much shorter duration of a slow. Now before you argue that the {{champion:91}}  should either jump first or jump afterwards the slow is finished, a stupid idea in it's own right, I then wish to simply say that the overall change is still a correct course of action, just that there are a few tiny holes in the change that may need to be addressed or at least considered.

I think that the strongest slow is applied over all other slows, then after that duration runs out the next strongest slow applies until that runs out and so on. I think that was to target percentage slows stacking with each other which made playing against a team with lots of slows really annoying because you can literally get reduced to 30ish movespeed against team with nunu, kogmaw and tryn and that is not fun to play against. So in your case I'm guessing the talon's slow would work for the 0.25 seconds and after that the nasus slow will kick in.

I do like the idea, but it would mean that some abilities' slows are useless. What is the point of a slow ability of someone else already has used the slow (apart from the damage)? I think that the slow should be calculated by 100% of highest slow + 50% of second highest slow +25% of third highest slow... This would at least give meaning to the other players' slows.
SO EVERY AP ITEM IS GETTING MORE COST
BUT IT MAKES EVERY ITEM SORT OF EASIER TO GET AND WITH BETTER SCALING SO THE OTHER FED TEAM DOESNT BLOW YOU UP AND PREVENT YOU FROM BUYING A NLR CORE ITEM AT ALL DURING THE ENTIRETY OF THE GAME.
I feel like this is buffing the mid game of all mages but the smaller amounts of AP available will nerf all mages' late game.
